snippet: Some women freeze meals, while others set up grocery delivery services. Others have texting or Skype rituals. For single parents, the transfer of responsibility is even trickier.
abstract: Working mothers who travel on business handle responsibilities for their children in various ways; some women freeze meals, while others set up grocery delivery services; others have texting or Skype rituals; for single parents, the transfer of responsibility is even trickier.
lead_paragraph: Some women freeze meals, while others set up grocery delivery services. Others have texting or Skype rituals. For single parents, the transfer of responsibility is even trickier.

headline.seo: For Mom, Business Trips Call for Emotional and Digital Logistics
